## Square Root of Two

Inspiration [here](https://americanhistory.si.edu/collections/search/object/nmah_694637).

First, let's get a canvas.

```{r canvas, fig.height=3, fig.width=3}
library(tidyverse)
plt <- 
  ggplot() +
  coord_cartesian(
    xlim   = c(0,3),
    ylim   = c(0,2),
    expand = FALSE
  )
plt
```

Next, we need a semi-circle.

```{r semicircle, fig.height=3, fig.width=3}
crcl <-
  tibble(
    r = seq(0, 180, 1)*pi/180,
    x = 1.5*cos(r) + 1.5,
    y = 1.5*sin(r)
  )
plt <-
  plt +
  geom_polygon(aes(x = x, y = y), crcl)
plt
```

Overlay a transparent rectangle.

```{r rectangle, fig.heigh=3, fig.width=3}
plt <-
  plt +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 0, xmax=2, ymin = 0, ymax = 2),
            alpha = 0.5,
            color = 'white')
plt
```
